alert.note: Alert for DeSoto; Lafayette; Marshall; Panola; Quitman; Tate; Tunica (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 12:24AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Lee, south central Crittenden, northwestern Lafayette, southwestern DeSoto, southwestern Marshall, Tunica, Tate, northwestern Quitman and northern Panola Counties through 100 AM CDT... At 1224 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lewisburg to near Tunica. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hernando, Senatobia, Coldwater, Como, Walls, Tunica, Crenshaw, Horseshoe Lake, Lake Cormorant, Strayhorn, Harmontown, Eudora, Dubbs, North Tunica, Dundee, Arkabutla, Barr, Phillipp, Independence and Robinsonville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for eastern Arkansas...and northwestern Mississippi.

area.areaDesc: DeSoto; Lafayette; Marshall; Panola; Quitman; Tate; Tunica
